summary: This is a service request log from August 15, 2019, detailing a priority upgrade and installation of a new Nice Vision surveillance system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The work was assigned to the Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP) and involved installing servers, a decoder, encoders, and configuring cameras.

keyFacts: A new Nice Vision surveillance system was being installed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York in August 2019.
The installation involved 4 servers, 1 decoder, 12 NVE2016 encoders, and approximately 161 cameras.
As of August 15, 2019, approximately 110 cameras were named correctly and 20 cameras were non-functional ('out').
Training for a communications technician named Daniel on the new system was scheduled for the following day.
The service request was marked as a priority and required a phone call to a specific number (844-802-0188) on the day it was created.
